Posts.Content: Mom23 I know how you feel - I didn’t want to tell anyone until I had a definite result but have caved in now and told my sisters - it was getting too hard trying to avoid them and they knew something was going on. Could you maybe tell your sister a half truth and say you’re not feeling too well and just blame the many bugs going round and you’ll let her know towards the end of next week? Hope you sort something out x
Posts.Title: Went for checkup - fast tracked to Breast clinic, freaking out.

Posts.Content: Oh my goodness I feel like I’ve just been reading my own story except I’m one step further on. I had a routine mammogram and got a letter a week later recalling me for further tests. I too am on HRT. My mum also had breast cancer when she was 3 years older than I am now but thankfully recovered and passed away a few years ago at 84 from bowel cancer. Had my appointment at Breast clinic last Tuesday and was told they could see a “dense mass” in my left breast. This was followed by a scan and biopsy on the lump. I am back for the results on Wednesday morning and have been to hell and back during the past week. Have managed to stay off google but remember vividly my mum going through it all - and yes I know things have moved on in the last 30 years. I am desperate for Wednesday to arrive but absolutely dreading it too. Not told anyone in the family apart from the hubby - luckily my two lovely daughters are both away at uni but I can’t even begin to image how to tell them if the results are not good on wed. I have 4 sisters and have held off telling them too until after I know what I’m dealing with on Wednesday.  So glad I’ve found this lovely forum and reading all the helpful advice has made a huge difference. Good luck mom23 and I hope you get a good outcome when you get to the clinic.
Posts.Title: Went for checkup - fast tracked to Breast clinic, freaking out.

Posts.Content: Hi all - been back for my second biopsy results today.  Turns out it’s pre-cancerous so they are just going to remove the lump and no further treatment required other than more regular check-ups. So relieved and thanks everyone for the lovely support x
Posts.Title: Went for checkup - fast tracked to Breast clinic, freaking out.

Posts.Content: I think that’s the worst bit trying to carry on as normal and not telling my girls while I wait for the results.  My eldest gets very emotional over the smallest things so really don’t want to worry her unnecessarily - I’m more worried how she’ll cope than I will if it’s not good news tomorrow lol.  Thank you for your kind thoughts and no doubt I’ll be posting tomorrow whatever the outcome
Posts.Title: Went for checkup - fast tracked to Breast clinic, freaking out.

Posts.Content: Mom23 Best of luck on Tuesday - will keep everything crossed for you. Let us know how you get on x
Posts.Title: Went for checkup - fast tracked to Breast clinic, freaking out.

Posts.Content: That’s wonderful news Mom23 - so pleased for you.  Now relax and enjoy life xxx
Posts.Title: Went for checkup - fast tracked to Breast clinic, freaking out.

Posts.Content: Thanks - can’t wait to get tomorrow over with and dreading it at the same time. Don’t think I’ll be getting much sleep tonight!
Posts.Title: Went for checkup - fast tracked to Breast clinic, freaking out.

Posts.Content: Hi ladies - bit of a mixed emotions day. Back at the hospital for biopsy results but these were inconclusive so had to have another set of 6 biopsies done using the mammogram machine.  The good news is the lump is very small which they think is why the first biopsies which were done using ultrasound didn’t hit the right area.  Got to wait another 2 weeks for results now but feel a bit more positive that even if it is a tumour, it’s so small and hasn’t spread they might just be able to remove it.  Still 2 more weeks of waiting to get through though first.  I’ve told my 2 daughters now and they have been great so one less thing to worry about.
Posts.Title: Went for checkup - fast tracked to Breast clinic, freaking out.
